DOC.brief_summary: This randomize clinical trial study educational intervention reduce work disability breast cancer survivor . Web sit provide symptom management education may effective method help breast cancer survivor reduce work disability treatment
DOC.brief_title: Educational Intervention Reducing Work Disability Breast Cancer Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Determine feasibility usability Work Ability Improvement Through Symptom Management Ergonomic Strategies ( WISE ) empirically evaluate effect short-term work ability among breast cancer survivor ( BCS ) . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . Explore individual workplace factor associate work ability BCS . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . ARM I : Patients receive access WISE web-based educational intervention help BCS manage symptom , identify ergonomic workplace problem risk , implement ergonomic modification . Patients also receive standard care comprise symptom management therapy pamphlet employment right . ARM II : Patients receive standard care comprise symptom management therapy pamphlet employment right . After completion study treatment , patient follow 3 6 month .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed breast cancer Employed time cancer diagnosis ( define pay employment > 20 hours/week ) Within six month completion active treatment Working treatment intend return work follow active treatment Computer internet access Patients intend continue/resume work follow treatment Develop distant metastasis progressive disease Prior diagnosis malignancy site except situ carcinoma cervix nonmelanomatous skin cancer
